intro: Crepis gracilipes, commonly known as slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and yellow, appearing in late spring to early summer. Crepis gracilipes is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a common weed in some regions.
